title: Rebecca Gibney hints at Packed to the Rafters returning but says there are still 'many hurdles'
text:
The last time we saw her Packed to the Rafters character Julie, she and her husband Dave embarked on a national road trip.

And on Friday, Rebecca Gibney hinted that the series could return after it concluded its six season run in 2013.

Speaking to TV Tonight, the 54-year-old actress said there have been official talks about bringing back the series, but warned fans not to get their hopes up just yet.

'There have been discussions': Rebecca Gibney (pictured) hinted at Packed to the Rafters returning but said there are still 'many hurdles' to go on Friday

'There have been discussions. There are a lot of hurdles to overcome - many, many to overcome before that could even become a possibility,' Rebecca said.

The Halifax actress insisted 'it's definitely not a fait accompli', which means nothing has been officially decided.

'As we sit here right now, it's not a "thing" yet. But it might be. It wouldn't be in the same capacity,' she said.

Tentatively optimistic: 'As we sit here right now, it's not a "thing" yet. But it might be. It wouldn't be in the same capacity,' Rebecca said. Pictured as Julie Rafter on Packed to the Rafters

It is not known what Rebecca meant by Packed to the Rafters not 'returning in the same capacity' but it could hint at a change of format.

Last month it was reported by TV Tonight that the Channel Seven show could make the jump to streaming service Amazon Prime Video.

Amazon will purchase the rights of the entire series before producing a new season called 'Back to the Rafters', according to the publication.

Throwback! Last month it was reported the Channel Seven show would make the jump to streaming service Amazon Prime Video, this time as 'Back to the Rafters'

Rebecca knows better than anyone that old shows can make a huge comeback.

She is currently filming Halifax: Retribution, a reunion series of Halifax f.p., which originally aired from 1994 to 2002.

Original actors Anthony LaPaglia, Jacqueline McKenzie and Rick Donald will return while Jessica Marais had to pull out due to 'work and personal commitments'.
description: The last time we saw her Packed to the Rafters character Julie, she and her husband Dave embarked on a national road trip.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
